blocks.name: cmwgfs
blocks.content: The set of weakly grammatical formal systems.

blocks.name: cmesy
blocks.content: The syntax typecode function for expressions.

blocks.name: cmgfs
blocks.content: The set of grammatical formal systems.

blocks.content: The indexing set for a syntax axiom.

blocks.content: The set of unambiguous formal sytems.

blocks.name: df-m0s

blocks.name: df-msa

blocks.name: df-mwgfs
blocks.content: Define the set of weakly grammatical formal systems. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2016.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mwgfs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cmwgfs, crab(s0, cmfs, wal(s1, wal(s2, wal(s3, wi(wa(wcel(cotp(cv(s1), cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cmax, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(c1st, cv(s3)), cfv(cmvt, cv(s0)))), wrex(s4, crn(cfv(cmsub, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s3), cima(cv(s4), cfv(cmsa, cv(s0)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-mwgfs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ mWGFS = { s0 ‚àà mFS | ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2, ‚àÄ(s3,((< s1, s2, s3 > ‚àà(mAx ` s0)‚àß(1st ` s3)‚àà(mVT ` s0))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà ran((mSubst ` s0)), s3 ‚àà(s4 "(mSA ` s0)))))))}
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-mtree
blocks.content: Define the set of proof trees. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2016.)

axiom df-mtree(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, setvar s8, setvar s9, setvar s10) {
  |- wceq(cmtree, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cpw(cfv(cmdv, cv(s0))), cpw(cfv(cmex, cv(s0))), cint(cab(s3, w3a(wral(s4, crn(cfv(cmvh, cv(s0))), wbr(cv(s4), cv(s3), cop(cfv(cm0s, cv(s4)), emptycls))), wral(s4, cv(s2), wbr(cv(s4), cv(s3), cop(cfv(cfv(cmsr, cv(s0)), cotp(cv(s1), cv(s2), cv(s4))), emptycls))), wal(s5, wal(s6, wal(s7, wi(wcel(cotp(cv(s5), cv(s6), cv(s7)), cfv(cmax, cv(s0))), wral(s8, crn(cfv(cmsub, cv(s0))), wi(wal(s9, wal(s10, wi(wbr(cv(s9), cv(s5), cv(s10)), wss(cxp(cfv(cfv(cmvrs, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s8), cfv(cfv(cmvh, cv(s0)), cv(s9)))), cfv(cfv(cmvrs, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s8), cfv(cfv(cmvh, cv(s0)), cv(s10))))), cv(s1))))), wss(cxp(csn(cfv(cv(s8), cv(s7))), cixp(s4, cun(cv(s6), cima(cfv(cmvh, cv(s0)), cuni(cima(cfv(cmvrs, cv(s0)), cun(cv(s6), csn(cv(s7))))))), cima(cv(s3), csn(cfv(cv(s8), cv(s4)))))), cv(s3))))))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)

  ‚ä¢ mTree =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà P((mDV ` s0)), s2 ‚àà P((mEx ` s0))‚Ü¶ ‚ãÇ { s3 |(‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà ran((mVH ` s0)), s4[s3]<(m0St ` s4), ‚àÖ >)‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s2, s4[s3]<((mStRed ` s0)` < s1, s2, s4 >), ‚àÖ >)‚àß ‚àÄ(s5, ‚àÄ(s6, ‚àÄ(s7,(< s5, s6, s7 > ‚àà(mAx ` s0)‚Üí ‚àÄ(s8 ‚àà ran((mSubst ` s0)),(‚àÄ(s9, ‚àÄ(s10,(s9[s5]s10 ‚Üí(((mVars ` s0)`(s8 `((mVH ` s0)` s9)))√ó((mVars ` s0)`(s8 `((mVH ` s0)` s10))))‚äÜ s1)))‚Üí({(s8 ` s7)} √ó √ó(s4 ‚àà(s6 ‚ãÉ((mVH ` s0)" ‚ãÉ((mVars ` s0)"(s6 ‚ãÉ { s7 })))),(s3 " {(s8 ` s4)})))‚äÜ s3)))))))}))
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)

blocks.name: df-mst
blocks.content: Define the function mapping syntax expressions to syntax trees. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2016.)

blocks.name: df-msax
blocks.content: Define the indexing set for a syntax axiom's representation in a tree. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2016.)

blocks.name: df-mufs
blocks.content: Define the set of unambiguous formal systems. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2016.)
